title.narrative: Supporting poverty reduction and inclusive and sustainable economic diversification of Bama County in China through innovative upgrading and world-level branding of health-related food value chains

description.narrative:
In an official letter of the Bama County Committee Secretary to the Managing Director of Programme Development and Technical Cooperation at UNIDO, dated 26 April 2020, the Bama Authorities requested UNIDO to support “the sustainable socio-economic development of the Bama Yao region and China” through the development and implementation of a project enhancing health industry and related value chains that contributes to poverty reduction and economic development of the region. In the request letter, the Bama Authorities confirmed interest to fund the project in an amount of EUR 750,000.
In the process of the Project Proposal’s coordination with the Ministry of Commerce of the People's Republic of China (MOFCOM), MOFCOM expressed interest to support the Project and designated the China International Center for Economic and Technical Exchanges (CICETE) as implementing agency from the National Side. Further, national partners CICETE expressed interest to complement the Project funding with the amount of USD 200,000 from China’s contribution to the UNIDO Industrial Development Fund (IDF) and to support its efficient coordination.
The global objective of the Project is to contribute to the implementation of the national development strategies in regional development and poverty reduction, through supporting innovative, inclusive and sustainable development and world-level branding of health industry and related food value chains in Bama County of China. This project would allow fostering sustainable development and poverty reduction, facilitating employment generation and economic diversification of Bama County while also strengthening grouped SMEs in green value-added backward and forward linkages with the growing health tourism sector with the ultimate aim to establish and brand internationally the Bama region and its processed quality and safe food and other produce. Through applying best resource- and energy-efficiency practices while upgrading local productive activities, the project will also contribute to raising the profile of the county as a national Green and Environmental Protection Exemplary City.
Thus, the current project is also in line with the following priorities of the UNIDO-China Strategical Cooperation Framework 2018-2021 (SCF): green industry, food safety, China in the world, and innovation.
